subject: Relationships
title: The Sunk Cost Trap in Relationships
description: A 60-second lesson on The Sunk Cost Trap in Relationships.

hook.text: 'I've given him seven years. I can't leave now.' The years you've spent become the reason you spend more.

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy: continuing an investment because of what you've already put in, not what you'll get out.

discovery.text: In relationships, sunk costs include time, emotional energy, shared assets, children, and social identity.

twist.text: The more you've invested, the harder it feels to leave ‚Äî even when staying costs more than going.

climax.text: Your past investment is already spent. The only question that matters: is the future worth the ongoing cost?

punchline.text: Years invested don't justify years wasted. Only the future matters.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy in relationships?
options: Staying because of past investment rather than future benefit
